application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Erection of two/three/four storey building comprising of 14 self-contained flats, 14 parking spaces (including 1 disabled), altered access from Kings Avenue (Outline Consent with landscaping reserved)
decision_conditions: Approval of details of the landscaping, including children's play area, (called the "reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON: The application is in outline form only and is not accompanied by full detailed landscape plans, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Plans and particulars of the reserved matters for the development referred to in condition 1 above, relating to the landscaping of the site, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority and shall be carried out as approved.  Reason: To ensure that no part of the development commences until reserves matters are approved. This condition reflects the provisions of Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act and Article 4 of the Town and Country (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 in accordance with Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004)." | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed prior to occupation of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | The development will be affected by traffic/commercial noise at a level which falls into Category C noise exposure.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for Developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the amenities of future residents and occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (2004) and supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | An arboricultural report shall be submitted upon completion of the excavation works for foundations and at the end of construction confirming that the root protection zones of the conifer hedge line to the west of the site as defined by BS5837: 2005 has been suitably protected.  If a breach of these zones has occurred, details of mitigation measures to ensure that the long-term health of the hedge is not compromised shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and such measures shall be implemented as approved and maintained permanently thereafter.   REASON: To ensure that the long-term health of the conifer hedge is provided for in the interests of the visual and landscaped amenity of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Details of pedestrian and vehicular visibility splays (that measure 1.5m x 1.5m at either side of the access with no obstruction above 0.6m in height) and other highway safety measures at the entrance to the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development and such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON: In the interest of Highway safety, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 2449/25 Rev A shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.	  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Prior to commencement of development, full details of the cycle parking and storage areas shown on the approved plan 2449/25 Rev A shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These areas shall be provided in accordance with the approved details and shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.	  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | The refuse storage building shown on the approved plan 2449/25 Rev A shall be fully constructed before first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for refuse and recycling storage and shall not be used for any other purpose.	  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse and recycling storage within the site, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and its associated facilities demonstrating compliance with the requirements of 'Secure By Design' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of adjoining occupiers and prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 'Safer Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of development, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 2.7 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | The existing vehicle access(es) to the site shall be permanently closed before any part of the development permitted is occupied or brought into use; and the footway along shall be reinstated, and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: In the interests of highway safety and the visual amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary development Plan (2004). | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the development to achieve a reduction in carbon dioxide emissions of 20% shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the details approved shall be so implemented prior to first occupation of any of the buildings in the development and permanently maintained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the buildings are acceptable in terms of renewable energy targets set out in policy 4A.7 of the London Plan. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with Lifetime Home Standards.   REASON: To ensure compliance with Lifetime Homes and Wheelchair Housing standards, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
